title: Isidro García (boxer)
text:
Isidro García Ayala (born 15 May 1976) is a <a href="Mexican%20people">Mexican</a> former professional <a href="boxing">boxer</a> who competed from 1994 to 2010. He held the <a href="World%20Boxing%20Organization">WBO</a> <a href="flyweight">flyweight</a> title from 1999 to 2000.
Professional career.
In May 1998, Isidro won the <a href="World%20Boxing%20Organization">WBO NABO</a> <a href="flyweight">flyweight</a> title by beating veteran Everardo Morales and ended up making four title defences.
WBO flyweight title.
On December 18, 1999 Ayala won the <a href="World%20Boxing%20Organization">WBO</a> <a href="Flyweight">Flyweight</a> title by upsetting Puerto Rico's <a href="Jos%C3%A9%20L%C3%B3pez%20%28boxer%29">José López</a> over twelve rounds. Lopez at the time was scheduled to fight <a href="Alejandro%20Montiel">Alejandro Montiel</a>, who withdrew hours before the fight. Ayala, a spectator on that night, agreed to fight in Montiel's stead and won, to much surprise, using borrowed equipment. 
He also defended his title successfully against Jose Rafael Sosa in <a href="C%C3%B3rdoba%2C%20Argentina">Córdoba, Argentina</a>.
